Great spot for authentic food. We all shared flautas and some tacos, which were delicious. The interior is nothing fancy, but the service was excellent.

I'd give it five stars if only the Camerones Diablo were always on the menu. They are very hot, and very, very, very good, but are an occasional special. -- The horchatas are also a bit better than the usual.

Stopped for lunch on our way to visit the Clark County Museum and the Hoover Dam.  Read the reviews and decided to try it out.  I had wanted the Dos Fish Taco, but they were out and recommend substituting shrimp.  My husband had the shrimp burrito. Both meals were outstanding and seasoned perfectly. I loved the salsa bar, especially the creamy avocado. Everything was very fresh.  The grilled onions and peppers in my tacos were slightly blackened and added some perfect smoky flavor.   So glad we found this great little place.

Fast,  in my neighborhood,  friendly.  Slight grilled flavor to my asada super burrito. Huge, filled to the brim.  I know there were other components,  I could see them, but truly great beef flavor. Now I don't want to be totally out of line but let me be straight.  You know that hungry? The hungry we get as a woman when it's that time of month?  The I'm so starved I could eat the ass out of a rotting rhino kind of hungry?  That was my appetite tonight.  After this burrito I'm feeling the beast curl up for the night.  It's no longer gnawing at me threatening to cause me to rip something from limb to limb to satiate my hunger. I may just delete my Cafe Rio app after this.   Oh, and the avacado verde salsa is tangy,  spicy,  creamy.  I'm in food heaven right now.

Good Mexican food is hard to find in the Midwest, but you can find some here. The corn tortillas are made fresh, which makes a world of difference. The salsa is spicy, and the pastor and carne asada tacos are what you should get. They also offer classic Mexican dishes like mole, chile relleno, and menudo and pozole on the weekend. Tacos are served Mexico City street taco style with only chopped onions and cilantro on top. The only thing I don't really like about Taqueria Guadalajara is that the entrance opens onto the kitchen, which feels really weird. Dining room is in the back.
Best in Madison by far. I have had almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed yet. Can't wait to go back again!

Thank goodness for Yelp because I never would have tried this restaurant without reading the great reviews!  The food was absolutely incredible - good sized portions, very cheap, very flavorful.   We sat at the counter, so we were able to watch them make our meals, which I highly recommend.  I had the veggies tacos and the potato gordita, my husband had the mole burrito - everything was so good!  I can see how the atmosphere could scare some people away, but I think it added to the experience of eating there.

Probably the best kept secret in Madison.  If you think you like Mexican you haven't seen anything yet.  Go here and you'll never eat faux Mexican (i.e. Taco Bell, Chipotle, etc.) ever again.  You can get a seat at the bar and watch them cook the food right in front of you with Telemundo playing in the background.  This place is authentic Mexican food and the people are very nice.  I am a fan of the sopes and their cow tongue is pretty tasty too.

Very nice, clean restaurant. Great customer service. Only issue we had was on the cheese that is crumbled over the enchiladas, a huge hair smack right in the middle of it. Due to having facial hair myself, right away I could tell that it was from a mustache or beard. From there we looked towards the kitchen and noticed that the counter girl, who was also helping in the kitchen, had her hair in a loose pony tail with no hairnet. Pretty sure whoever had facial hair was not covering their face as they were cooking as well. This might have changed our view on the food before we even began eating. But nonetheless, without complaint, we ate and the food was good. Very generous portions and you are given fresh chips and salsa while you wait (which was great). Definitely worth trying!

I can't say I've tried a lot of the dishes on this menu before, but that's only because the first thing I tried at this place was their beef tongue, pork stomach, and beef intestine tacos; I love them so much that I've never really had the urge to get anything else! Of course, those tacos are not for everyone's tastes but I really love that traditional items like those are available here. I've tried bites of their burritos as well as bites of their dinner platters and really found those to be tasty, too. Really, I just love to bring others here so I can order my tacos and steal bites from their order so I can sample more of the menu--ha!

OMG.  I LOVED this place.  It is exactly what I look for in a hole-in-the-wall restaurant.  The atmosphere is crowded and chaotic.  The prices are low.  And the food is great.  I had chicken enchiladas with mole sauce, but I plan to be back for much more.
The food was delicious will definitely be coming back. The employees here are very nice .

I've lived in Henderson for a year and 1 month.  My husband and I moved from Chicago and were completely spoiled with the most delicious Latin food.  Tacos, burritos, carne Asada, shrimp Diablo and so on.  It was always fantastic.    We have had extreme difficulty finding anything worthy of being called good here in NV. Yesterday we tried the regular sizes chorizo and chicken tacos and they were slightly better than good.    I only have four stars because the meat options are not as good as I'd like.  I do not want chitlin tacos.  The beef option was from an odd part of the animal and I couldn't bring myself to try it.  The tacos we had were flavorful and spicy.  The chorizo was so spicy that we were both blowing our noses.  We like that kind of spice.   I found the two regular sized tacos and a handful of chips (free when you eat in) to be very filling.  Right now this is the only place I know of to get a decent taco.

DON'T LET THE SHADY PINK BUILDING FOOL YOU! YELP helped me discover this hidden gem. The food was super good and super authentic. I found my inner fatman while I was here and sampled two tacos, a gordita, and sope. The TACOS were to die for. By far MY FAVORITE. I had one steak and one pork. DELICIOUS! The SOPE and GORDITA were just more of the same goodness in a fried tortilla. Super Good, and Super Cheap. Check it out!

This place is five stars for food but the service is lacking. Food is the best in Madison. The chips and salsa possibly the best I've ever had. The only problem is they give you a really small basket and you have to ask a few times for a refill of the chips but be sure to always ask for salsa because getting them to refill that is also a chore. Everything I've had is delicious not a bad item on the menu. The taco dinner only comes with two but they are hearty and filling even if you're use to getting three.

1st off its new and they have a few service issues but are so friendly they made it fun to deal with.  The tacos are excellent and the menu has everything even Vegan options. I'm not vegan, just want to make that clear lol The orders from other tables looked great too. .............. They had a salsa bar but No pickled carrots or onion and cucumber, If you're the owner and reading this, that's a must.  I will give you the 5th star when I see the carrots

First visit here, the shop just opened about 3 months ago.   Super Tacos Carnitas: Amazing. I bought three not knowing what to expect I would have been completely satisfied with just one. They are topped with avocado slices and sour cream, not my usual go to but glad I wasn't turned away by it. I absolutely loved the combination and the flavor was well balanced. I finished two and had to take the last one home. It was well worth the $4.50 charge per taco. The super taco is the perfect blend of a taco and a sope.  Carne Asada Fries: Huge, fresh guacamole, jalapeños, sour cream, the usual. It tasted really good and I'm not someone who would normally order this for myself. I was allowed to taste and can safely safe they were great. Everything just tasted fresh, the meat was flavorful, everything was bountiful.   Charritos: $7 It came with 8 slices total. If you have a sweet tooth this is the perfect go to. Brought some home and they tasted just as great the next morning.   Salsa Bar: I was impressed with the salsa bar. Normally the salsas are bland and made for the mass majority. That's not the case here, you can definitely find one that's spicy, medium, mild and have them still taste really good!   Would I ever come back? Yes! Authentic? Yes. Pricier then others? Yes.  Well worth it? Yes.   I have been going to Fausto's for almost 10 years now. It's the best fast food option for Mexican over others. I like it but if I'm ever near Taqueria Guadalajara then I'll definitely just go here.

Demand in our house hold for REAL Mexican food is high. Husband is from LA, Phoenix, and comes from down home Mexican cooking family. Myself, I look and need flavor, but not overwhelming heat. This place... The Mexican gods above smile down upon.  We've had a few Mexican places and living in a city that thinks great Mexican food is Pedro's.. We never thought we would find a place that reminded us of home cooking. TG hit it out of the park.  Chips and salsa given to us at the start were impressive on the salsa front. Mild with a bit of heat. Husband ordered the menudo, lengua tacos, and Horchata. All phenomenal. I ordered the green chili verde enchiladas. Everything was melt in your mouth with amazing flavor. Couldn't have been happier. Ran around $26 for everything. A steal.   Family is visiting in the fall and we will absolutely be bringing them here. And we will be going back again.. And again.

FINALLY! I found good carry-out mexican food in Madison. I usually go to La Hacienda out of old college day habits of seeking cheap cheap cheap mexican food. Lately, I've been seeking something better like I got used to while living in San Diego...Guadalajara was pretty close. I went to Francisco's first, but they were closed on Sundays (they did have a sign in the window "$10 margarita pitchers" so I have a feeling my straw and I will eventually try it out).  I got a burrito which was outstanding and only $6. My only complaints were that the cheese was melted on the exterior (making it hard to eat w/o a fork and knife), it was zapped in the microwave (unnecessary if the cheese was placed inside), and the lady was trying to be skimpy on the salsa (I wanted to try it all).   Everyone was speaking Spanish, it was extremely quick, the staff was very friendly, all the other food going out looked great, the place seemed clean despite its quirky late night drunken Cabo taco shop appearance and the salsa was really good in my opinion.   I can't wait to go back!

We've been looking for a good Mexican restaurant since moving from California.  And so far Taqueria Guadalajara is the best, hands down, of all the places we've tried.  We've been here twice.  On both visits we ordered the Burrito Mexicano, which is huge and has an excellent balance of meat, cheese, rice, and beans.  The salsa, sour cream, and guacamole on top (which helps create the colors of the Mexican flag) give it good additional flavor.  We've also ordered both times the tacos, which are also tasty--we've ordered the carne asada and pastor tacos.  Great meat flavor and greasy enough to add flavor but you won't have grease dripping down your arms.  We've also had the chicken and cheese tamales, which had good flavor but there wasn't a whole lot of filling inside (especially the cheese), and a sope with chicken, which was delicious with a thick corn tortilla that is crispy on the bottom but soft on top and delicious meat, again.  For our son, we ordered a kid's quesadilla which was alright.  The cheese wasn't melted, but I think they did that so that he didn't burn himself.  If that's the intention, then that was very nice of them.  Our son, as well as do I, loves the horchata, which is a sweet rice drink.  It was tasty and wasn't too thick with rice.  A little more cinnamon would be nice,  though.  And, to be honest, last time we went, I had read Brad R.'s review and was scared about getting food poisoning.  I probably hate being sick more than the average person, so I understand his warning.  However, as I let that thought leave my mind and focused on enjoying the food, I started to think: I'm sure that if you talk to enough people, you'll find someone who has gotten food poisoning or has had some horrible experience at EVERY restaurant there is.  If you want a surefire way to avoid food poisoning, you'll have to stay away from ALL hole-in-the-wall, but authentic places like this restaurant and go to Taco Bell or cook your own food and cook the hell out of everything.  Again, I believe Brad, and I feel bad for his experience, but at the same time, I think you've gotta have trust in a place and hope that you don't get sick.

One of the best Mexican restaurants in Madison. Great prices. Good food.  We got a variety plate with roasted jalapeño that was so, so hot.  I couldn't believe a jalapeño could be that hot.  Horchata was amazing to cool it down.

Two weeks after visiting San Diego I'd been craving real Mexican food worse than I'd ever craved Chipotle previously. Came here with my buddy from SoCal to try to dwell the pain.  Carne asada burrito and horchata were quite good. Had I not been enlightened by the bliss that is San Diegon Mexican food, I'd probably give this 5 stars.   Neat atmosphere, you can see the whole kitchen from the "bar" area and it's in what appears to be an old house. I'll probably be back soon.
Best Mexican in Madison. Better then la fuenta on the 92nd street in Milwaukee. Traditional Mexican. Expanded seating area in back.

The food was meh. The service was extremely slow. The times that I've come here I've often waited for at least 25 mins for my food to arrive at the table. That was horrendous. I understand the restaurant is usualy packed, but I don't understand why it takes that long for the kitchen to prepare the food.

This is considered one of the best taco places in Madison, and it is just that.  The best taco place in Madison, not the best I've had regrettably.   I decided to go outside "the norm" and ordered the cow tongue and intestine taco.   It was well cooked, garnished, and presented, but lacked taste.  Some foodies believe that to truly appreciate the taste of a meal you shouldn't season it, but I'm not them.  A pinch of salt would've carried this dish a long way.  I also decided to be adventurous and ordered the cactus huaraches and unfortunately I didn't like it.  Something felt amiss.  Maybe it's because it didn't have meat, but from perception alone I was hoping for a heartier feel after eating it.   Nonetheless, better than most taco places, but I miss my taco trucks.

Yep, this is definitely my favorite place in Madison for Mexican food. It's not only extremely good, it's consistently extremely good.  The place is pretty small, but I've only ever waited 2-3 minutes one time in all the times I've been there.

Wanted to try this place for a while now. The menu is pretty extensive. But the cashier/ owner will answer any questions you might have. I ordered the carne asada fries and they were yummy! Skinny French fries covered in refried beans, cheddar cheese, sour cream, guacamole, crispy edged pieces of carne asada and topped with queso fresco cheese. It was a huge plateful. I ate what was just maybe 1/5 and yet I was already full. The place was clean. I will definitely be going back again for something else on their menu sometime soon!
As advertised. Excellent Mexican fare. Tremendous service and personality. Weekend soup specials worth the visit.

Nice local Mexican restaurant. Pricing is excellent, and I enjoy my usual pork chimichanga. Food is served fast and service is great every time. Only complaint is it can be awkward while paying or waiting for a table with the narrow walkway at the front.

Ravings on Yelp got me curious. So I finally went there with my beau to satisfy odd hour early evening hunger.  Um, not my type of authentic. Yes, it's cooked by very very friendly Mexican family, and I appreciated their service. But based on my backpack trip experience in Mexico, I'd prefer Mercardo Miramar tacos over this one.   What's authentic is the group of guys at the counter with beer, munching on food, and having small talks in between watching soccer game.
If you are familiar with authentic Mexican food this restaurant is a little bit of a let down. Food is filling and a good amount for what you pay for. One of the only Mexican restaurants in Madison.

Steak chimichanga is damn delicious! The cheese when you first cut into it is a work of art. The tacos are also very good. I like all the taco meat options. You can't go wrong with pastor or steak or chicken.   I just love this place. The service is fast, the chips and salsa hit the spot and the prices are unbeatable.
I love this place! One of the BEST taco places in Madison. You can pick anything on their menu and it will be delicious! This is a great place to sample the menu with a friend.

I challenge you to find better Mexican food in Madison.   Just dined there since it's re-opening and it's only gotten better. Clearly they invested in the infrastructure. The salsa got even better and they will sell it if you want to put it on everything you have at home. (guilty)  It's authentic and flavorful. Squeeze limes on everything like its your job. Ask for more salsa because it's that delicious. The torta can easily feed two & is crisped to perfection. My partner in crime had the tacos and left none standing. Everyone was silent as they dined.   So glad you're back taqueria!  There isn't a lot of seating, so I'd be careful during peak hours. TOTALLY worth the wait. (And easy on your pocketbook!)

Yes!  Finally, a Mexican place that is totally authentic. Went here to celebrate a new job three weeks ago. My kid raved about his burrito Mexicano, as did my fiancé. I got the chimichanga and was not disappointed at all.  Everything from the guac to the fillings was authentic. If you love Mexican food, come on in!  It's great!

Local local local. We came here for a late lunch and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The food was authentic and the atmosphere was quaint. Expect to feel like you're eating in someone's living room. The menu had plenty of choices, but I was surprised to see there were no margarita choices. Luckily, we were planning on drinking. They did have some Mexican beer, if you're really needing an adult beverage.

If all you're concerned about is the food, then I would strongly recommend going. This place has excellent authentic Mexican cuisine at an incredibly reasonable price. It was even named by USA Today as one of the Top Ten Authentic Mexican Restaurants in the U.S. So the food is great!  If you're going for the whole dining experience, I would have second thoughts. The place isn't very nice, definitely a dive, and there isn't much seating at all. The waiter struggled with English, not that there is anything wrong with that, it just makes it difficult to get a good recommendation. Last but not least, the place isn't located in the greatest area, there is limited parking and they don't have a full bar.
The food is very good I love the salsa bar..... very good customer service fast and clean menudo in the weekend yummy I recommend habanero salsa

Found this place searching up lunch in my work area and seen they're new so I definitely had to try them out and hands down-- BEST burrito I've ever had. It was huge and almost couldn't finish it (keep in mind that I have a B I G appetite). This place definitely surprised me! Upon entering I was greeted immediately by the cook over the counter grilling a heap of what looked like shredded chicken on the grill. First look the actual building itself looks dated- supposedly used to be a burger joint(?), but when you walk in you can tell the place was remodeled nicely and they definitely do a good job keeping the place very clean. The salsa bar was also very neat and I had the chance to try the guacamole and the reddest salsa there (which was pretty spicy).   I had previously ordered for pick-up and the man on the phone said it'd be ready in FIVE minutes.. So it definitely was ready when I approached.  It came out to about $7.52 after tax, and the lady who rang me up thrown in some tortilla chips which tasted homemade along with my heavy burrito.  I had the al pastor burrito (no beans) and it was phenomenal. You can tell the cook actually 'prepares' the food. Something most mexican 'fast food' restaurants I've been to ignore to do. The tortilla was actually slightly grilled on the bottom of the burrito to seal it nicely. The meat was well done and not runny at all. The Spanish rice was flavored nicely, and the pico de gallo tasted very fresh.   I know this was beyond in depth, but they deserve this 5 star review. Great job Taqueria Guadalajara. I'll be back! Thank you!

Excellent quality, probably the best taqueria in Henderson. I've had menudo everywhere you can get it in South Henderson (Faustos, Robertos, Cuevas, Don Tortaco, Santa Rosa), and these guys have the best - hands down. Also, it's the only taco shop that sells beer and the michelada was on point. Their prices are a little higher, but you get what you pay for. So, if you find yourself suffering from a hang over, you owe it to yourself to get a bowl of menudo and a beer from this place. I'll definitely be coming back to try the rest of the menu.

Take all my money in exchange for the closest thing I'll come to in Wisconsin for breakfast tacos.   Their service is surprisingly good for having such few staff. Those few staff are working their butts off though, boy howdy. If you know you'll want extra salsa, tell that to your server right when they give your table the first batch of chips and salsa. They always customize my weird requests like subbing out meat for an extra egg, instead of sunny side up, wanting scrambled, and getting the hot sauce on the side (confession: I'm a "dipper," I'd prefer to dip my food into sauce rather than have it spread on my dish).   Come here if you want a delicious, legit Mexican-style dish and are willing to wait a little bit extra while you sip on coffee or a real sugar cane Coke and eat chips and salsa. Doooo it.

There is much to like about Taqueria Guadalajara 2.0: the service is efficient, the menu extensive and you get incredible bang for the buck.  I like but not love the food; there are sub-par elements of any meal juxtaposed against some near transcendent elements.  While not my favorite Mexican restaurant in town, it is certainly in the conversation.  The Parrillada that my table ordered during my last visit to Taqueria Guadalajara exemplifies uneven performance of the kitchen.  This dish for four consists of various Mexican grilled meats, roasted potatoes, knob onions, deep-fried jalapeños and grilled cactus.  The steak and rib meat was superb, with a char on the exterior but not overcooked. The same goes for the slightly sweet knob onions, which helped balance out the pile of unctuous grilled meat.  And the oh-so-wonderful corn tortillas served on the side were thick, fresh and loaded with flavor.  On the flip side, the overcooked chorizo added a crunchy element the dish did not need.  The potatoes could provide that textural component if properly prepared, but instead, the limp, under-seasoned spuds seemed out of place, considering the generous pile of starchy Mexican rice served on the side.  The same study in contrasts occurs with the complimentary chips and salsa.  The bland, slightly stale tri-color chips seem out of place in a restaurant that serves such wonderfully fresh corn tortillas.  Taqueria Guadalajara serves two salsas with the chips.  The flavor-packed spicy version is expertly prepared while its milder sibling is a watery mess.  Once you get past the uneven performance of the kitchen, the performance of the restaurant shines.     The expansive menu offers a vast variety of choices, including numerous vegetarian options.  Adventurous eaters can dine on pig stomachs or beef intestines while the kid's menu gives you the ability to feed the bambinos when you elect to bring them along.  On weekends, the restaurant offers pozole and menudo.  The generous serving sizes mean you will be toting a doggy bag when departing the restaurant.  I have enjoyed top-notch treatment during my visits.  While not overly gregarious, the servers are cordial and efficient.  Even when slammed with customers, I always receive water and complimentary chips and salsa within a couple minutes of being seated.  Also appreciated is how the servers keep a keen eye on the chip basket.  When the chip level starts running low, the server will promptly ask if the table if they want a refill.   They also consistently perform other service basics liking checking in after they deliver the food and promptly removing dirty dishes.    For a mom-&-pop Mexican restaurant,  Taqueria Guadalajara gets a gold star for cleanliness.  The stainless steel open kitchen still gleans as it did when the restaurant reopened and the tabletops are always spotless.  The serving area is relatively small and there is scant space between the tables.  Eating during peak hours means it may be difficult to carry on a discussion with tablemates at conversational tones.  The dining room has the obligatory muted flat screen tuned to a Liga MX match or other Latin programming.   Pro tip:  When perusing past reviews, be aware that a completely remodeled Taqueria Guadalajara reopened on August 8, 2013 after a fire closed the restaurant for over six months.  You should discount any comments about the gritty nature of the eatery before that date.  So if you find yourself travelling the South Park Street corridor with a heavy appetite and a light wallet, do not hesitate to pay Taqueria Guadalajara a visit.
Love your tacos! Sill our favorite Mexican plan in Madison. Quick service. Great prices. Keep it up

If you consider service, price, consistency, speed and quality of food, this is hands down the best restaurant in Madison. While it should not be mistaken for a high end affair, if your stomach is the final arbiter, you will feel like royalty when you stumble out the door and back on to Park Street. Required stop for visitors :)

Ok, the burritos and tacos are good. The staff, however, is consistently rude and condescending. They look at you and grunt if you don't hurry up and choose quickly. On more than one occasion I've had the girl taking my order roll her eyes at me! So if you're ok with rude staff then you'll be fine.

Not as impressed as I wanted to be. I tried this place on two separate occasions because of the great yelp reviews and getting well ranked in the Annual Manual. I just wasn't a fan. Had tacos one time and huaraches the next but both times I felt it something was lacking.

I am basing this on one visit and usually like to visit multiple times before reviewing, but I'll give it a shot. When I go again, I'll update. I would probably have given it three stars, but I'd heard so many good things and I was disappointed, and I also always like to promote what I call Madison's triumvirate of awesome if lesser known Mexican places: Taqueria Guanajuato, La Hacienda, and Antojitos El Toril (technically in Monona, but that town is ours too :) ).  So all I got here were three gorditas containing three different meats. I haven't much more than this to say: all three of them were very standard, nothing that stood out positively in either the meats or the toppings stuffed in, and the ultra greasiness, like to the point of nigh-on immediate heartburn, stood out negatively.  I do understand that good and/or authentic Mexican is greasy, but not like this.

Oh my goodness....I love love love this place!! I've been trying to find good enchiladas and chile relleno since I moved and came to Wisconsin and they have both. The food was hot and fresh. The staff were friendly and helpful. My husband enjoyed the steak tacos. They give you two types of salsa with tortilla chips when you are seated ...one was very hot but both were tasty. Qdoba, Chipotle are fast food compared to this place and I can't even go in those places with a straight face after going to this Taqueria. I will definitely be returning!!
Very good. Good service. Authentic Mexican fare. Very, very casual.  Ignore the 2star reviews and just go. You will be glad you did.

Hola. Los burritos de taquería Guadalajara los Recomiendo mucho. Sus salsas están muy sabrosas especialmente la de chipotle, cualquier hispano que viva o trabaje en el área de henderson taquería Guadalajara es buena Restaurante para comer o cenar, es comida como echa en casa muy al estilo Guadalajara. Yo recomiendo Taquería Guadalajara. Gracias.

I love this place! I moved to Madison from New Mexico, so I was understandably mourning the loss of my favorite Mexican restaurants back home. I can't say it's as good as those old favorites (hence 4 stars rather than 5), but it's consistently good, and you can't beat the prices. I've had every vegetarian item on the menu, and have been pretty happy with all of them. Their tortillas are fantastic, and I highly recommend the horchata.

Back and better than ever!  How do you take an already solid place and make it more remarkable? A new sleek space.  New furniture!  New paint! Stunning... I'm talking stunning stainless steel! A really cool storefront that's a bajillion times better than the old.   But what hasn't changed?   Still (in my opinion) the most authentic Mexican joint we have in Madison. It's meat on a corn tortilla. With some pico and cilantro. That's what I ate for 7 years, I'm thrilled to keep the tradition alive, and I haven't found anything better in the 608. (People try though... why does everyone want to convince me to keep looking?)

I'm so glad Madison has real Mexican food! And Guadalajara does it well. Cheap prices, cane sugar sodas, Mexican cable channel blaring, an open kitchen so you can actually see them cooking your food, and a friendly atmosphere. We ordered lunch to go and it was delicious. Their house marinated pork is AMAZING. The chicken enchiladas are also very tasty. Guadalajara is also open quite late, which is great if you ever get those late night munchies.  The waitress also seemed incredibly capable and on top of things. I see a lot of complaints about the service of this place, but I was honestly impressed. Considering the restaurant was kinda packed, we received great service for being to go customers. We were greeted with a friendly welcome, and she even gave us chips and salsa while we were waiting to take home our order. I usually don't tip when I get take out, but I couldn't help it after seeing the waitress handle everything so swiftly and elegantly. I guess I just have a soft spot for hard-working, capable waitresses :)  I didn't get to try the tamales this time, but I saw some people buying them by the gallon-size bag and they looking delicious. I'll have to get tamales next time...

This place is so good! Reminds me of the restaurants in California. The tacos are packed with meat and the burritos are huge! Everything has great flavor. I'm looking forward to trying the menudo on a weekend. Don't hesitate to go here, you will leave stuffed and wondering when is the next time you can go back. Warning the salsas are spicy, but hey that's how they are supposed to be!
Great authentic Mexican food.  Reasonably priced.  Quick.  Must try.  Would go everyday if i could.  I believe they serve beer as well.  Try the chimichanga.  Best Burritos around.

Mahogany high-backs, salsas x 5, and cheap, nummy lunch deals. Yup, they bring you as many salsas, just for sitting down, as there are A's in Guadalajara.  What it isn't: high-quality ingredients. What it is: almost free from Tex-Mex super-flavorful Taqueria that also does Tortas, Chilaquiles, Chile Rellenos, etc. There were Fajitas, so that's the almost. I had slighty-angry belly later that day, which is the no-high-qual.  There's so much good food lining this road that the small lunch crowd we were part of made sense, I guess. Still, the flavors are solid, Chilaqulies done right - crisp but soaked (and part of a combo so I could have an enchilada or Relleno too!! first for me!), fried egg on the side. They drew a smiley face with Crema on 'em for me.   I like you guys too.

I had their super burrito with grilled chicken.   The ingredients were very fresh and flavorful.   The burrito was huge and very filling.   Restaurant staff was very courteous and helpful.  Highly recommended!

This place is fantastic!!! Came here for lunch last weekend and everything was wonderful...the food and service! The salsa is yummy and the servers don't seem to mind when you ask for more tortilla chips.  They were also very helpful in making sure that we had vegetarian food and were great about making substitutions. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in town :)
Went there again and the refried beans did not taste like I remembered. I think they changed up the recipe. Everything else was still solid though.
Honestly my favorite restaurant in Madison, anything you order here is going to be great.
Food wasnt hot when we got it,slow service, store bought chips (stale) with salsa. Taste of food was decent but definitely nothing special.

I moved to the midwest from southern california and on a cold day felt like having Mexican food. It took a few minutes to get seated, a good sign. It was Southern California style, although my food could have been hotter. The tacos were okay, but I'd probably try something else next time. Their horchata came from a mix, but they added some spices, and it was good. Friendly staff, and things moved quickly, but were didn't feel rushed.

Found a toothpick in my chimichanga (bit into it and have a cut in my mouth), this is second time it has happened to myself and a member of my party on two separate occasions. The staff didn't seem to care when I brought it to their attention. The food is good but not sure it's worth the health risk.
Es buen restaurante. Lo recomiendo. Dan un excelente servicio y la comida esta genial.
Best Mexican food in town. This place is authentic. Don't settle for any of the chain "Mexican" restaurants. The prices are cheap too.

I didn't have the same experience as all these rave-reviews.  The food came fast and the wait staff were polite but the food was distinctly average and bland.  Not good or bad, just meh. I've had better and will likely go elsewhere for my next Mexican food craving.
Incredible Mexican food. Very authentic and delicious. It gets very crowded but the line goes pretty quick. Highly recommended.

Went in last Thursday night with another couple. Had very quick and friendly service. I got the mole enchiladas which were excellent and filled me up. Tried the beef tongue taco that my friend got and it was extremely juicy and flavorful. For great food and awesome service I highly recommend Taqueria Guadalajara. I will definitely be back.

This place opened not far from our house in Henderson.. family and I decided to give them a try.. so glad we did!! We had the tacos carnitas, lengua and cabeza de res being from Texas we were glad see these items on the menu!! We definitely will be back and support a local business!

So happy I stopped in! With places that serve "authentic Mexican food" it gets tiring trying to find a good spot in town. This place is totally hidden, but so worth it. They have a pretty extensive menu, different choices for different tastes- seafood, chicken, al pastor, carne asada, head, tongue. It's so good. They're on the pricier side - made us a bit apprehensive to try, but man, do it! I ordered nachos with cabeza. They were super prompt. My food was hot, looked phenomenal and made my mouth absolutely water. The chips were made in house- crisp not greasy and crunchy. The meat was cooked perfectly and they featured 3 types of cheese. They were so yummy. Seriously go to taqueria Guadalajara- it's boooomb.
The real thing- a hole in the wall type of place with delicious food that is very reasonably priced.  And it's open until 11.  Yum.

Taqueria Guadalajara on Park has some huge positives going for it, which will certainly bring me back, but on the occasion of my first visit there were a few things that were less than stellar. I could see TG regularly hitting a 4 star review and occasionally even a 5 star, but this was my experience today:  Chips and salsa: These were really disappointing. The chips seemed undercooked and were a little leathery. I came in with my son and we were given very few chips. When we asked for more we got another very small basket. The salsas were pretty good (especially the hot), but again the quantities were very limited. I'd happily pay a bit more for enough chips and salsa to enjoy rather than having to ask over and over for very small batches.   Burrito Mexicana (w/ Carne asada): The burrito was a good size and the guacamole on top was pretty tasty, but that was all of the good. The carne asada had a nice texture, but it was pretty flavorless. A little salt and lime could have gone a LONG way here. There was WAY too much lettuce inside and no enough of everything else. There was also a LOT of tortilla relative to the size of the overall burrito, but fortunately the tortilla was quite good.   Lomo de puerco in salsa verde: Overall this was my favorite dish of the day. I was hoping for something close to chili verde (which this is NOT), but I enjoyed what I was served nonetheless. The salsa verde has a really good taste, but was a little on the thin side. I also enjoyed the grilled onion served with dish, that added a lot. The pork loin was sliced very thinly and seared pretty hard on the flat top, so it was a little dry. The rice and beans on the side were a nice compliment, and the corn tortillas were excellent! In fact, the corn tortillas may have been the single best thing I had during the entire visit.   The best thing about TG is the authenticity of the food. There are a number of other dishes I'm excited to try that I think could benefit from this exact authenticity. It's also nice that TG is VERY affordable, but as I mentioned above I'd be okay paying just a bit more for a few things to be a little better. Parking can also be a bit of a chore, but I was lucky and got a spot right out front. The service was very good, and the space is fairly comfortable, albeit slightly on the smaller side. I expect to update this review in the future, but for this particular visit I'd say TG was about a three star stop.

I had to used the Eat Street service because I couldn't get out for lunch and was hungry for Mexican food.  I had never been to Taqueria Guadalahara before so I was a little scared about what I might get.  I ordered the Enchiladas Mole with cheese and it was fantastic and exactly what I wanted.  It came with refried beans, Mexican rice and a little wedge of lime was a nice touch.  Sour cream and fresh avocado were extra, but at .35-.40 cents each, it was well worth it.   Loved it!

Was visiting Madison for the Great Midwest Beer Fest and prior to getting in line for the opening we headed west a bit and via Yelp landed in this little Taqueria.  From the front it almost looks too small to dine-in as there are no tables and just a small counter.  But the server will lead you back, literally through the kitchen, to the dinning area in the back of the restaurant.  As we were in a bit of a hurry I didn't spend too much time searching the menu, quickly selecting a torta.  Our server brought some colored chips and two types of salsas; the chips were good but the salsa was nothing great.  The torta on the other hand was excellent, the steak was juicy and had a hint of grilled, smoky flavor.  The sandwich was huge and was more food then needed (had to save room for 5 hours worth of beer sampling).
Drove two hours to this place. because someone said it was good The food was terrible, I have a lousy waitress with a bad attitude. Go somewhere else!

The (very few) negative reviews on here are a joke.  This place is awesome.  We've had a number of their tacos and burritos and all have been excellent.  The service can be a little slow on the weekends, but only because they make everything from scratch.  It's well worth the wait.  We also went on a weeknight and had our food within 5 minutes, so it just depends on when you go.  A great addition to the limited food options in older Henderson.

Stopped by said they just opened 4 days ago and it's close to my work. Everything I ordered was fresh made and tasted excellent..tacos were flavorful, one of the best tacos I've had. I liked the salsa bar great choices and fresh flavors..and xxxxxx- hot slasa which I love. I hope this location lasts because everything else has failed there. Go check them out you might be surprised..and a bonus they have Coke products! If they get busy they might wanna increase the staff had to wait a bit but all my stuff was made fresh and they are new..will be back for sure.

Fast and friendly service.  Clean and affordable.  I had the carne asada and pastor Tacos and a side of Orden de cebollitas cambray.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I wish the taco meat had been better seasoned.  The pastor was not bad, but the steak was very bland.  Everyone I was with seemed pleased with their meal and my husband said we could come back for sure (he is kind of picky). He had the steak quesadilla plate.

Delicious and very well-priced!  When my boyfriend and I visited this place we both had the equivalent of two meals, plus our daughter also had her own tacos, and the total came out to be less than $30 - including the tip!  Not to mention that the food was better than anything else we've had in the Madison area!  I had the chicken mole enchiladas and it was beyond delicious.  As soon as the waitress was walking up to our table I smelled the spices and thought I was smelling something out of a bakery!

This place is so good! Very authentic and great prices!  I had the chicken chimichanga which was awesome. It came with rice, beans, and pico on the side and it was plenty of food for one person.  My friends had the beef tacos and they also looked amazing with just the right amount of cilantro. Just make sure you ask for cheese if you like cheese on tacos like I do. I would defiantly eat here again and for the cheap price why not!

Mi amor...how did I not review you earlier, Guadalajara? Have been going here since it first opened and it's really exciting to see it flourish!  Chips are now served with both a mild red salsa and a quite hot green salsa.  The tacos and gorditas are the best with either steak (carne) or carnitas (pork), in my opinion.  The gorditas are just steaming hot pockets of deliciousness with refried beans, meat, and cheese.  They do have some vegetarian options on their menu as well.  The guac is the one item that's kind of "eh" since it's overly pureed rather than with big chunks.  If you have a group of 4-5, you can order the parrillada, which is an assortment of sausage crumbles, pork al pastor, thinly sliced potatoes, and green onions& potatoes.  All of this is served with rice, beans, guacamole, pepper mix, and tortillas, and it'll feed a crowd!  Love going here, always satisfied with the food, and it's great to see the same friendly faces when you go.

Tried this on a dare.  An awesome "little hole in the wall" place.  A very small place that offers an abundance in variety of hispanic foods.  This has to be one of the best Mexican restaurants I have visited here in Madison.   Staff is great and food comes fast.     You are not there for the ambiance...its all about the food.  This is a must try if you haven't yet.

Qualifications:  Resident of San Diego for 4 years, frequenter of Taco Shops.  Quick synopsis:  Highly Recommended, great food great prices.  Will go back soon.  We had a group of 4 total, one of which is an 11 month old baby, for lunch around 1:30 on a Saturday.  We sat at a table pretty quickly however the 2 baby seats were taken.  By the time were were leaving every available seat was taken.  To start they brought out some chips and salsa.  The chips were regular but the salsa's were home made and fantastic.  There was a red and a picante.  I bought a cup of the picante for $4 to take home, it was pretty much the perfect spiciness.    Between us all we order Chile Relleno, Taco Dinner, Veggie Sopa, Chicken Enchilada, and a Chicken Taco.  My order was the Relleno and for $7 I couldn't expect anything more.  Rice, re-fried beans, lettuce, tomato, the chile, and 5 corn tortillas.  I was really stoked on the tortillas because usually a place only gives you like 2.  Everything on the dish was very good.  I was actually really surprised on how tasty the chile was.  It came with a "traditional red sauce" on it that complimented it really nicely.  I am a pretty big eater and was satisfied after I was done.    My baby had the chicken taco for $2.  She can't talk but we are pretty sure she loved it.  We were really happy that there was something so simple on the menu we could offer her.  I finished off what she didn't eat and I thought the shredded chicken had a great flavor and was tender.  My wife got the taco dinner that came with beans and rice.  It came with 2 tacos carne and pork.  She said she really liked the carne but the pork was pretty standard.  She wanted to specifically note that the tortillas were fantastic, I agree.  Mother in law got the Sopa ($3) and Enchilada ($7).  I had a bite of each.  I haven't eaten too much sopa but it was absulutely delishes, I like to call it an open faced tamale.  Her burrito was covered in a green sauce that had quite a nice flavor, you could really taste the pepper in it.  MIL said they were really good and the value for the price was excellent.  I wish I could give out fractions of stars because I don't really like giving out 5 unless it totally blows me away.  I would give them at least 4.5 though.  It exceeded our expectations, which started high, and the prices were very good.  The dining area isn't very large so if you have a big group I would probably stay away.  But for a family I think it was perfect.  Nice moderate ambient noise to keep baby happy and great food for dad.

Hmmmm. I've driven past this place over 100 times, so I thought with the reviews it's received, I'd try it out. Not too impressed. I had the Super chicken burrito, free chips/salsa, and a can of Diet Coke. Without the chips being complementary, I would've given this place 2 stars.   The burrito wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. Like others have said, it's HUGE. Then again, so are most other "taco shops" in Vegas. The difference here, is it was very tasteless. Everything blended in to a blah tasting mess of ingredients. No flavor in MY burrito.  Another complaint, is not that they only have cans of coke products(not fountain), but that they charge about $1.50 a can. That's frigen crazy. There could charge $.50-$.75 a can, and still make a profit. $1.50 is what you usually pay for unlimited fountain soda.  The chips were just ok. They have to be from a bag, and not made in restaurant. Most mexicans places in Vegas either make their own or serve mexican-restaurant style chips vs these Tostito's type chips.  Their salsa "bar" was good, and even though it had more options than Roberto's or Don's, I actually like Baja Fresh and Rubio's salsa and salsa selections WAY better.  All in all, I'm not saying I wouldn't eat here again, and will probably give it another shot to try out something else... but if it's the same again, I'd probably just drive 6ish blocks away to Roberto's from there on..

I used to live practically across the street from this place, and finally went one balmy summer night.  It's really good food, and great service - especially at such reasonable prices!  It really is a hole in the wall.  There are a couple of tables jammed in with a lunch counter, so it's definitely a place for small groups.  There is also a porch for a few extra tables in the back, which is great for warm summer nights.  If you're sitting at the counter, you can watch the cook prepare your meal right in front of you.

If I want to get tacos or a burrito in Madison this is the place I go. The place is small and can have a wait sometimes but if you ask me that's how you know it's good. The burritos are more than enough food to satisfy most anyone and the tacos come in a ton of varieties. And of course why not wash everything down with a Mexican Coca-Cola!   You might have to walk a block or so after you park but it is more than worth it.
This is the real deal restraunt. Home cooked food with a home felt decor. The $2 tacos are out of this world and very affordable. I'm happy to frequent this restraunt often.

Taqueria Guadalajara was a great place for Mexican food. We met some friends for dinner. The seating area is fairly small, but the restaurant has a good ambiance. Our waiter didn't do much for us, other than taking orders and bringing the food. He didn't check back with us once. We received 3 out of 4 plates at one time, then the last plate a few minutes later. My friend also ordered soup and our waiter did not bring the soup until later on, despite having brought the soup toppings with the rest of the meal.

This place is awesome. Small, but awesome! We've been here a couple of times now. Had the carne asada, chicken, carnitas and empenadas. Everything was great! Super nice people that own it. Service might be a little slow, but not too bad, but that's because they make everything fresh. Highly HIGHLY recommend it.

I found this place by just driving down Park Street,  looking for tacos, as one does on the weekends.    Everything they were taking out to other tables as I waited looked really good and smelled amazing.  But my food was not anything to write home about.  I got the 2 pastor taco meal with beans and rice,  and an extra taco-- because I wanted to try the lengua. The pastor was really bland.  In my opinion,  if I have to add avocado, a ton of lime,  etc. to the taco to make it taste halfway decent, it's probably not a good taco.  The lengua taco was eh. I've had good lengua before,  and this had an old beef taste-- like it sat in the fridge thawing too long before it was cooked kind of taste.   I ended up just scooping up beans and rice with chips and left my tacos to be tossed.  I expected better,  since they had a couple best of Madison framed certificates up on the wall. Sadly,  I probably won't be returning to try anything else. If the tacos are blah,  I can't see the more complex dishes being much better.

We decided to try this place one night a few weeks ago so we tried Taqueria Guadalajara. The tacos are amazing and very large, pork el pastor and carne asada are my favorite so far. This was my second time eating here and it was better than the last. This place really knows authentic Mexican food. The restaurant is very clean and well kept. The staff is very friendly and brings your food to you at the table, they are really nice people. I read on their Instagram page that they originated in the Bay Area where is also where I grew up, In my opinion this place is far above Roberto's and the rest of the taquerias you see all over town. We will be back for sure!!

Still haven't dropped the ball. Been going here for years now. Mi Ranchero is my favorite, Chorizo, Steak, Grilled Cactus and whole grilled onions. It brings back memories of Oaxaca, warm nights & Modelo Negro.

This is one of those true Yelp success stories.  I grew up mostly in Madison but lived in Milwaukee for a number of years where Mexican food is ridiculously good.  Whether it be from one of the amazing restaurants on the Southside or the authentic Mexcian grocers (El Ray), you really can't go wrong.  Up until I went to Taqueria, I hadn't run into a restaurant in Madison that I would even deem "acceptable" for Mexican food.  There's a few places that were decent, but nothing that ever stuck out or that had all the right stuff put together.  Each place lacked either taste, proper pricing, or variety on their menu.  Well Taqueria Guadalajara solves that issue ten-fold in my opinion.  They are pretty much just what others describe here; a very very small mom & pop operation with a comfortable environment and amazing food at good prices.  Portion sizes are also quite generous.  The staff is polite and the TV usually has either soccer or mexican soap operas on, adding to the authentic vibe.  The food needs to be emphasized here though, they have some fantastic options.  First off, the chips and salsas are tasty, they give you a hot blend which I found enjoyable and a mild blend which is has a very traditional taste (cilantro, tomatoes, etc).  Make sure though that you order Guacamole, even if it takes them a while to bring it out.  Their fresh homemade Guac is out of this world, and this is coming from a guy who doesn't even like Guacamole.  I have to put it on everything I get here though, as it's just that delicious.  Secondly, there are a few main dishes I've had worthy of note.  I'd say the best deal they offer are the tacos, my girlfriend got 2-3 tacos each time with a side, and I think they were about $1.75 or $2 per taco.  This isn't something from taco bell though, these are flavorful and fulfilling jam-packed tortillas, and if you get a side of rice and / or beans it should be more than enough food.  Some of my other favorites, albeit pricey, are the Mexican flag burrito and the Tortas (Mexican Sandwhiches) with slow-roasted pulled pork.  I'd rate one meat over the other, but the Carne Asada, the el pastor pulled pork, and the chicken were all mouth-watering.  Just make sure you wash it down with one of their many beers / sodas available.  Nobody's perfect, so there are a few minor qualms.  The service is terribly slow and inattentive.  They make up for it with warm hospitality, but we often had to wait for drink / chip refills to the point where we had finished the main course and usually had to wait a while to put in our order.  That said, they do get the main courses out promptly, the last time I went I had my meal in less than ten minutes.  Only thing is, we've seen this behavior when we went at 8pm at night on a weekday, so I have no idea how it is when they're packed.  My girlfriend said she went for lunch and it was crazy-crowded (she still got her food though).  Overall, Taqueria is a slice of delight in an unexpected location.

It's hard to find a good authentic Mexican place in Madison, but for the price here, it is pretty good.  The mole was not very impressive, but I usually try to avoid mole made in the Midwest.  However, the enchiladas verdes were tasty and came in a good portion for the price.

The expansion in the back of the restaurant looks great.  They did a really good job and added a nice amount of tables so you're not waiting too long but at the same time the small kitchen isn't overburdened with too many tables.  Food is still great.
This is one of my go to places! I love street tacos, and this place is solid. I honestly can't speak to anything else other than their tacos! Cheap and good!
We tried the cactus dish, burrito and quesadillas. Everything was well prepared. Love the also sauce they serve with nacho chips  I like the open concept kitchen

Mexican patrons lining up outside a Mexican place is always a good sign. The place is a hidden gem in Wisconsin. It doesn't show up on most internet top ten lists, but most residents know about the place.   I had a pork chimichanga for $7. When they say stuffed with meat, it was stuffed!! They did not shortchange me. The same item in a fancier setting would be at least $20. It was a little greasy, but hey, it is a deep fried burrito.   The spicy salsa is good. But do ask for gauc. It was very well done. I also tried a Jarritos which is supposed to be a Mexican soda. I went with lime though most people recommend the tamarind. My partner had the chicken enchiladas which was flavorful.

After living in San Diego for 7 years and eating at virtually every taco shop in SD county, I know what constitutes a good taco.   Taqueria Guadalajara whips up some legitimately GOOD tacos, especially the al pastor. In the last 2 weeks, I have been probably 5 times and have tried carne asada tacos and al pastor tacos. I haven't tried anything else on the menu but I am confident it is all delicious.  Check them out!

We had a really good dinner here and will definitely be back. It is a small place, but there is seating in the back, so do try it. We were there early and got right in, but it was filling up by the time we left. I had the chicken enchiladas verde and my dining companion had the burrito mexicana. Prior to our entrees they brought us chips and two different salsas. I am a fan of heat, so I loved them both, but the hotter of the two maybe too intense for some. Our dinners came with rice and beans, and they there both delicious! Everyone that waited on us was pleasant and cordial. After we got there we noticed they prefer cash because of the service charge, and I felt bad we only had a card. Note to self next time bring cash. I love frequenting local places, and this is one we will definitely be back to. Tasty, flavorful food and good prices.

Best Mexican in Madison (well chimichanga, at least!). I love the green salsa and the chicken chimichanga. Perfect hole-in-the-wall family-owned  kind of atmosphere; everyone is super nice. Highly recommended.  Only downfall is no margaritas!
The best authentic Mexican in Madison.  If you are up for a divey delicious and reasonably priced Mexican fix...this is your place.  Parking is a bit of a challenge but well worth it!!!

I hate to write a bad review because these folks are really trying hard. But, my Mi Rancho was not that good. Authentic (I never had cactus before), but the beef, advertised as steak, was very tough. The Mole Enchiladas, a specialty too, wasn't great either. I will go back to give them another chance, but with so many Mexican options they won't get a third try. Sorry.

Delicious, authentic food. Stopped in one night not too long ago.. The place was packed! Thought we would have to wait for a table, but they were able to get a spot almost immediately! They were out of Tamales which made me really sad :( But what I got instead was fantastic. Service was great - they were quick and attentive but not over the top.

Does not live up too its name! I have traveled all over the world and that includes Guadalajara MX, where the food is amazing!! some would call me a bit of a Food Snob. The food was over priced and wasn't very tasty. They had no limes or radish's there salsa game needs a lot of help tried all they had and everyone of them were sour and made the food taste worst. Which with so called Mexican food the salsa should compliment the food not make it worst. Giving this place there well earned two stars due to they did marinate there meats I had. Which is more then most do places do. But not enough to make me come back again. This used be a burger joint which was so so. But this place I don't think will be open very long. So (Real Mexican) food lovers you have been Warned!!

Let me preface my comments that this 5-star rating is based on best of class.  This eatery is not a white-table establishment, rather a hole-N-wall red and white checked table cloth kinda place...   I rate the food 5-star, the unique Mole sauce for enchiladas is unique and not an everyday experience... The average bill is about $10 a person.  They take credit cards but prefer cash...   Bottom line, great food at quality prices...

I was kinda scared to try a new taco place honestly this is probably the best taco place in phoenix, due to the location I didn't expect it to be as clean as it was. I'm very impressed. The carne asada tacos were wonderful, not full of lard. They have a salad bar with different type of salsa that is fresh!!! This is our new taco joint!!!

TG has risen from the ashes and spread it's wings. New front room, bigger kitchen but same good stuff. Try a bunch of tacos ($2) and a couple of sopes (a $3 pile of awesome) if you like but the steak Platillo Guadalajara ($10) is my favorite. Wash it down with a couple of Negra Modelos and walk away a fan muy contento.
